DataElement.preferredName: Additional Treatment Completion Success Outcome Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term for the measure of success of outcome after additional treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the additional treatment for progression._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion. (NCI)_An event that accomplishes its intended purpose._a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.:Success; an event that accomplishes its intended purpose.:a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
An event that accomplishes its intended purpose.
a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Added; extra; further._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Unknown outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Unknown outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Stable Disease outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Stable Disease outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/28/2015.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Progressive Disease outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Progressive Disease outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Persistent Disease outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Persistent Disease outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease that does not go to remission despite treatment.

Concepts.definition: A disease that does not go to remission despite treatment.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Partial Response outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Partial Response outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not Applicable outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not Applicable outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Complete Response outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Complete Response outcome after additional treatment (surgery and additional therapies)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 01/29/2015.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Added; extra. (from American Heritage Dictionary):An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Measure of success of outcome
ReferenceDocuments.description: Measure of success of outcome at the completion of additional treatment

DataElement.changeDescription: Curated to support The Cancer Genome Atlas, request of G. Diaz submitted 3/31/2010.
